channel.title: Router trouble
channel.description:
I am having trouble with my net gear router on chapter 1 (yer i know sad) of the server guide I'm on this part [glow=red,2,300][/glow] [glow=red,2,300]Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always[/glow]
my Net Gear "Super wireless" ADSL Router DG834GT do'snt have a gamming setting or even a portforwarding setting in fact there is it's entire lay out:
Setup Wizard
Setup Basic Settings ADSL Settings Wireless Settings
Security Logs Block Sites Firewall Rules Services Schedule E-mail
Maintenance Router Status Attached Devices Backup Settings Set Password Diagnostics Router Upgrade
Advanced WAN Setup Dynamic DNS LAN IP Setup Remote Management Static Routes UPnP
Web Support Knowledge Base Documentation If any one can help me through this section of the tutorial then I would be much abliged

eclipse245:

just save wat u have, but for the IP i would put like 2.2.2.2 or 1.1.1.1 instead of just 2

item.title: Router trouble
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

u don’t need the “gaming” icon thats for linksys routers i use a d-link, just keep everything the way it is, and you might have to add the UDP port as: 43594

Read full topic

item.title: Router trouble
item.dc:creator: @Gol_Goroth Gol Goroth
item.description:
@Gol_Goroth wrote:

I am having trouble with my net gear router on chapter 1 (yer i know sad) of the server guide I’m on this part
[glow=red,2,300][/glow]
[glow=red,2,300]Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always[/glow]

my Net Gear “Super wireless” ADSL Router DG834GT do’snt have a gamming setting or even a portforwarding setting in fact there is it’s entire lay out:

Setup Wizard

If any one can help me through this section of the tutorial then I would be much abliged
